refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: GtkAccelMapForeach ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*GtkAccelMapForeach) (gpointer data, const gchar *accel_path, guint accel_key, GdkModifierType accel_mods, gboolean changed);

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_add_entry ()
refsect2.para: Registers a new accelerator with the global accelerator map. This function should only be called once per accel_path with the canonical accel_key and accel_mods for this path. To change the accelerator during runtime programatically, use gtk_accel_map_change_entry(). The accelerator path must consist of "<WINDOWTYPE>/Category1/Category2/.../Action", where <WINDOWTYPE> should be a unique application-specific identifier, that corresponds to the kind of window the accelerator is being used in, e.g. "Gimp-Image", "Abiword-Document" or "Gnumeric-Settings". The Category1/.../Action portion is most appropriately chosen by the action the accelerator triggers, i.e. for accelerators on menu items, choose the item's menu path, e.g. "File/Save As", "Image/View/Zoom" or "Edit/Select All". So a full valid accelerator path may look like: "<Gimp-Toolbox>/File/Dialogs/Tool Options...".
Note that accel_path string will be stored in a GQuark. Therefore, if you pass a static string, you can save some memory by interning it first with g_intern_static_string().

listitem.simpara: valid accelerator path
the accelerator key
the accelerator modifiers

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_lookup_entry ()
refsect2.para: Looks up the accelerator entry for accel_path and fills in key.

listitem.simpara: a valid accelerator path
the accelerator key to be filled in (optional)
TRUE if accel_path is known, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_change_entry ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_accel_map_change_entry (const gchar *accel_path, guint accel_key, GdkModifierType accel_mods, gboolean replace);
refsect2.para: Changes the accel_key and accel_mods currently associated with accel_path. Due to conflicts with other accelerators, a change may not always be possible, replace indicates whether other accelerators may be deleted to resolve such conflicts. A change will only occur if all conflicts could be resolved (which might not be the case if conflicting accelerators are locked). Successful changes are indicated by a TRUE return value.
Note that accel_path string will be stored in a GQuark. Therefore, if you pass a static string, you can save some memory by interning it first with g_intern_static_string().

listitem.simpara: a valid accelerator path
the new accelerator key
the new accelerator modifiers
TRUE if other accelerators may be deleted upon conflicts
TRUE if the accelerator could be changed, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_load ()
refsect2.para: Parses a file previously saved with gtk_accel_map_save() for accelerator specifications, and propagates them accordingly.

listitem.simpara: a file containing accelerator specifications, in the GLib file name encoding

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_save ()
refsect2.para: Saves current accelerator specifications (accelerator path, key and modifiers) to file_name. The file is written in a format suitable to be read back in by gtk_accel_map_load().

listitem.simpara: the name of the file to contain accelerator specifications, in the GLib file name encoding

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_foreach ()
refsect2.para: Loops over the entries in the accelerator map whose accel path doesn't match any of the filters added with gtk_accel_map_add_filter(), and execute foreach_func on each. The signature of foreach_func is that of GtkAccelMapForeach, the changed parameter indicates whether this accelerator was changed during runtime (thus, would need saving during an accelerator map dump).

listitem.simpara: data to be passed into foreach_func
function to be executed for each accel map entry which is not filtered out

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_load_fd ()
refsect2.para: Filedescriptor variant of gtk_accel_map_load().
Note that the file descriptor will not be closed by this function.

listitem.simpara: a valid readable file descriptor

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_save_fd ()
refsect2.para: Filedescriptor variant of gtk_accel_map_save().
Note that the file descriptor will not be closed by this function.

listitem.simpara: a valid writable file descriptor

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_load_scanner ()
refsect2.para: GScanner variant of gtk_accel_map_load().

listitem.simpara: a GScanner which has already been provided with an input file

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_add_filter ()
refsect2.para: Adds a filter to the global list of accel path filters.
Accel map entries whose accel path matches one of the filters are skipped by gtk_accel_map_foreach().
This function is intended for GTK+ modules that create their own menus, but don't want them to be saved into the applications accelerator map dump.

listitem.simpara: a pattern (see GPatternSpec)

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_foreach_unfiltered ()
refsect2.para: Loops over all entries in the accelerator map, and execute foreach_func on each. The signature of foreach_func is that of GtkAccelMapForeach, the changed parameter indicates whether this accelerator was changed during runtime (thus, would need saving during an accelerator map dump).

listitem.simpara: data to be passed into foreach_func
function to be executed for each accel map entry

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_get ()
refsect2.para: Gets the singleton global GtkAccelMap object. This object is useful only for notification of changes to the accelerator map via the ::changed signal; it isn't a parameter to the other accelerator map functions.

listitem.simpara: the global GtkAccelMap object

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_lock_path ()
refsect2.para: Locks the given accelerator path. If the accelerator map doesn't yet contain an entry for accel_path, a new one is created.

Locking an accelerator path prevents its accelerator from being changed during runtime. A locked accelerator path can be unlocked by gtk_accel_map_unlock_path(). Refer to gtk_accel_map_change_entry() for information about runtime accelerator changes.
If called more than once, accel_path remains locked until gtk_accel_map_unlock_path() has been called an equivalent number of times.

Note that locking of individual accelerator paths is independent from locking the GtkAccelGroup containing them. For runtime accelerator changes to be possible both the accelerator path and its GtkAccelGroup have to be unlocked.

listitem.simpara: a valid accelerator path

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_accel_map_unlock_path ()
refsect2.para: Undoes the last call to gtk_accel_map_lock_path() on this accel_path. Refer to gtk_accel_map_lock_path() for information about accelerator path locking.

listitem.simpara: a valid accelerator path

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The "changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkAccelMap *object, gchar *accel_path, guint accel_key, GdkModifierType accel_mods, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Has Details
refsect2.para: Notifies of a change in the global accelerator map. The path is also used as the detail for the signal, so it is possible to connect to changed::accel_path.

listitem.simpara: the global accel map object
the path of the accelerator that changed
the key value for the new accelerator
the modifier mask for the new accelerator
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4
